channel.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
channel.description: how do you make it so if you walk to a certain spot you tele somewhere else thanks :)

item.description:

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“Ncarug01, post:20, topic:190938”]ugh okay then maybe the dig spade comand (to make this issue simpler) and less laggy
so you dig on a floor and tele
what does that do does that include the same method process[/quote]

No, on whatever action ID the spade use/dig is we check our coordinates, and if that check returns true we have some sort of action.

Read full topic

item.source: When you walk somewhere you tele :o

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:16, topic:190938”][quote author=Lusfr link=topic=254502.msg2121813#msg2121813 date=1205991839]

… OR …
Check only when the walking method is called. That was, it only checks when it needs to. (Also a good place to start for that areatrigger system, Ncarug01).

And apparently, Envion, what I posted was trash?

you wouldn’t want to call it for every tile the player moved or you would get massive lag, eh?
[/quote]No. At the end of the player’s movement process, a simple if statement would check the player’s coordinates and see if they are in a ‘trigger zone.’ If so, an action is performed. That is the best and most efficient way to create this ‘areatrigger system’.

Every player has their own client.java

Which is exactly the problem.[/quote]

Precisely. It’s a simple check-against - their absolute x and y positions against the values we loaded into memory on server initialization. If the comparison is true, we teleport them (maybe begin a 3-second timer, so they have a heads-up incase they don’t want to be teleported and only landed there by accident?) or take whatever other action we want this areatrigger to have.

Java isn’t the fastest language, but simple number crunches won’t turn up any noticeable hang.

Read full topic
item.source: When you walk somewhere you tele :o

item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

Every player has their own client.java[quote] Which is exactly the problem.[/quote]

We know every player should be shared using a better thread handling method.

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @Ncarug01 Ncarug01
item.description:
@Ncarug01 wrote:

[quote=“Lusfr, post:15, topic:190938”][quote author=Envion link=topic=254502.msg2121822#msg2121822 date=1205991936]

set current time mili9seconds so it only check ever 5-10 seconds or longer.

Would be a bit rough if we have a lot of players logged in already compared to doing a quick check against saved values in memory every time somebody moves. At least that way, we wouldn’t be doing one check per player each time. We might also be checking more often, true, but the check would result in detection of the player being on our trigger as they step on it instead of a potential wait of 5-10 seconds… unless what you’re saying is clearing my head by a foot and I’m getting none of it.

We’d just check on end position. That way the player can walk OVER it without issues, we only do anything if they land on it.

Tele, I’m just building on your initial idea here.
[/quote]

True, but I’m meaning if it is for like some type of mini game

well first things first
exactly how would i set up the method (the foundation)
how to i set up an area trigger
and 3 for the last post by lusfr wouldnt you make a control over that saying another person is using this feature try again in a few moments?

Every player has their own client.java[/quote]

that one part is true but we need to like end this i need to find out how to start it example public void areatriggers()
then code there
and then how do you start the area triggers

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:16, topic:190938”][quote author=Lusfr link=topic=254502.msg2121813#msg2121813 date=1205991839]

… OR …
Check only when the walking method is called. That was, it only checks when it needs to. (Also a good place to start for that areatrigger system, Ncarug01).

And apparently, Envion, what I posted was trash?

you wouldn’t want to call it for every tile the player moved or you would get massive lag, eh?
[/quote]No. At the end of the player’s movement process, a simple if statement would check the player’s coordinates and see if they are in a ‘trigger zone.’ If so, an action is performed. That is the best and most efficient way to create this ‘areatrigger system’.

Every player has their own client.java

Which is exactly the problem.[/quote]

in addition wouldnt we need to make another player handler or something

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

[quote=“Envion, post:13, topic:190938”][quote author=Lusfr link=topic=254502.msg2121799#msg2121799 date=1205991692]
set current time mili9seconds so it only check ever 5-10 seconds or longer.
[/quote]

Would be a bit rough if we have a lot of players logged in already compared to doing a quick check against saved values in memory every time somebody moves. At least that way, we wouldn’t be doing one check per player each time. We might also be checking more often, true, but the check would result in detection of the player being on our trigger as they step on it instead of a potential wait of 5-10 seconds… unless what you’re saying is clearing my head by a foot and I’m getting none of it.

We’d just check on end position. That way the player can walk OVER it without issues, we only do anything if they land on it.

Tele, I’m just building on your initial idea here.[/quote]

True, but I’m meaning if it is for like some type of mini game

[quote=“Ncarug01, post:14, topic:190938”]well first things first
exactly how would i set up the method (the foundation)
how to i set up an area trigger
and 3 for the last post by lusfr wouldnt you make a control over that saying another person is using this feature try again in a few moments?[/quote]

Every player has their own client.java

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

Lusfr:

set current time mili9seconds so it only check ever 5-10 seconds or longer.

Would be a bit rough if we have a lot of players logged in already compared to doing a quick check against saved values in memory every time somebody moves. At least that way, we wouldn’t be doing one check per player each time. We might also be checking more often, true, but the check would result in detection of the player being on our trigger as they step on it instead of a potential wait of 5-10 seconds… unless what you’re saying is clearing my head by a foot and I’m getting none of it.

We’d just check on end position. That way the player can walk OVER it without issues, we only do anything if they land on our spot.

Tele, I’m just building on your initial idea here.

Read full topic

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

If you’re going to do this in more than one location, consider implementing some sort of areatrigger system.

Take a look at how Player.java (haven’t browsed the typical mass-produced source lately, but I’m pretty sure it’s in here) loads data from individual player.dat files. Consider implementing that in, say, Areatriggers.java to load areatriggers from a similarly-constructed data into memory, and then check them against a player’s coordinates on each player movement.

Read full topic
item.source: When you walk somewhere you tele :o

item.title: When you walk somewhere you tele :o
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

There are two simple ways.

One, you can find the method that involves walking, and after the character has stopped moving, check its coordinates with an if statement. Something like

if(absX == 1000 && absY == 2000)
{
      teleportToX = 1;
      teleportToY = 2;
}

I forgot how to teleport because I haven’t opened one of those up for a long time. So look into that.

The second way is the constantly check each players location every half second. This will have the same result as the first option, but will create much more lag than needed. All you have to do is stick that if statement above into boolean process().

I reccomend the first option.

Read full topic
